topic.title: Getting started in Mingle
topic.p: This section will help you get up and running in Mingle. It's useful if you're coming into an existing project as a team member and need to know the basics of housekeeping and orientation. Your project manager and fellow team members are the best resources for introducing you to a new project since they would have setup Mingle to reflect the project's structure and workflow. There might be some useful pages that describe the project's structure and setup.
topic.hint: If you're looking for information about setting up Mingle, see Quick project setup.

section.title: Signing in
section.p: First of all you'll need to sign in to Mingle. Your project administrator should have setup your user profile and added you as a team member to the project(s) you're working on.

section.title: Updating your details
section.p: Once you've signed in, you may wish to update your user profile to make sure your email address is setup and that your source username is correct.

section.title: Finding your way around
section.p: Mingle's very intuitive and getting around shouldn't be too difficult. But here are some pointers.

topic.hint: If you want to find out more about what Mingle can do, see Welcome to Mingle and What's new in Mingle.
